title: Which Queen song owes the most to The Beatles? - Quora

response.answer_text: Overall I think Queen, like the Beatles, is uniquely melodically oriented and more so than most rock bands. I think that this is probably one of the ways they most influenced by Beatles. I also think that Freddie’s use of the piano in composing and performance has some influence from McCartney. Lennon to some extent also but I think McCartney was more of a piano man then John, even though he used the instrument beautifully too.Of course many artists and bands from the seventies could be said to owe much to the Beatles and show influence in many regards. I can’t say which Queen song owes the absolute most to the Beatles but a few songs come to mind especially ones that are in the “Dancehall” style similar to McCartney’s songs like “Honey Pie” or “When I’m 64”.    Sometimes Brian May’s voice resembles McCartney’s voice to my ears..not exactly but some nuances of it like when McCartney is singing more clearly and less in his rocker voice. The song “39” has a skiffle pop feel like “I’ve Just Seen A Face” and maybe a little bit of the maritime feel like “Uncle Albert/Admiral Halsey”…  Probably a musicologist or a Beatles music scholar could assess and identify other nuances of Queen’s music and determine to what extent there is Beatles influence . I’d Say that “Bohemian Rhapsody” has some influence from The Beatles in how it’s structure is episodic like “A Day In The Life” or “Happiness Is A Warm Gun” or “Uncle Albert/Admiral Halsey” or the Abbey Road Medley.
